events.name: Tech Saturday: Making More DIY Lab Equipment
events.description:
Sign up here: https://tinyurl.com/techsatsignup4

In Tech Saturday, volunteers will be using tech to address sustainability issues. We meet on Saturdays to learn and do projects together! Each project typically requires 8-10 weeks to complete.

The next season will be on 13th May to 1st June, 9.00 am onwards. In this season, we will aim to make a thermocycler and centrifuge. 

For our first meeting on 13th May, we would:
- Conduct Project Briefing & Lab Induction
- Form teams to work on different projects 
- Start working on the project

Sign up here: https://tinyurl.com/techsatsignup4


Why do we do this?
We would like to bring people from diverse background and skills together and create synergy for the purpose of sustainability. We would also like to experiment with Open Source Hardware Development, Circular Design and Frugal Engineering.

Is there any Pre-requisite to join?
Prior background in related topics e.g. science, engineering and design will help, but we welcome all who are willing to learn and commit to the projects. 

Is it free to join?
Yes! 
Note: Your contribution to the projects e.g. for material will be greatly appreciated.  

What do I need to bring?
Bring your laptops so that we can go through some of the digital contents conveniently. Also, wear comfortable clothing and covered shoe as we will be doing the hands-on projects in the makerspace.
events.location: Community Lab at United World College SEA, 1 Tampines Street 73, #01-D119, Singapore 528704

events.name: Introduction to Biomedical Science
events.description: CSM Academy invites you to the introduction to the world of Biomedical Science. This course preview is suitable for students/adults who have a vision of contributing to the world of Sciences and become a part of it. See you there!
events.location: CSM Academy International Pte Ltd, 250 Sims Avenue, Singapore 387513

events.name: MakerFaire Singapore 2017 Planning Session!
events.description:
Makerfaire 2017 is coming! Do you have a project in mind? Are you looking for a team to make it with you? Or you want to join a group and make something together? Whatever your interest is, come down to CommunityLab@UWCSEA on 13 May 2017, where you can suggest or join various exciting DIY projects to showcase during Makerfaire, happening on 22-23 July 2017. 

Note: We would prefer purposeful projects, projects that advance the cause of sustainability. for example:
- Can be used to benefit a particular community
- Interesting ways to generate energy e.g. gravity lamp
- Advancing citizen science e.g. DIY Bio
- And more!

But if you have something that you really want to make, come down anyway and we will see what we can do!
events.location: Community Lab at United World College SEA, 1 Tampines Street 73, #01-D119, Singapore 528704

events.name: Singapore Shapeways Meetup
events.description: It's been a while since our last Shapeways 3d printing meetup so here's one in conjunction with the upcoming Fashion & Accessories Edition of the Singapore 3D Printing Meetup XIV. Come by to see some of the accessories pieces printed via the many material offerings from Shapeways and chat with some of the fashion/accessories designers who use shapeways too! Also, when you're here with us, do go crazy snapping pics of the stuff! Do also share photos on Instagram, Twitter, etc, tagging Shapeways using @Shapeways or #Shapeways!

events.name: First Code Academy Summer Camps Info Session
events.description:
Learn to think by learning to code.
Know more about First Code Academy's pedagogy and comprehensive roadmap designed for students as young as 5 years old.
Come join us for an Info Session! Learn more about the course content, hear from the instructors, and discover what it means for your child to learn at First Code Academy.Please feel free to let us know if you have any questions in the meantime. Contact us: hellosg@firstcodeacademy.com | 6820 2633 


Shaping Future Creators
First Code Academy is a leading education institute that teaches kids coding courses and develop curriculum for K-12 students to learn not just coding skills, but computational thinking. Our goal is to empower children and teenagers to become creative leaders in the digital era, for their future career and for driving social change.
events.location: First Code Academy, 04-13 Stamford Court, 61 Stamford Road, Singapore 178892
